## utils.svgPaths.curve() function

Draw a cubic or quadratic curve. See developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/d\#Cubic\_B%C3%A9zier\_Curve These coordinates are unitless and hence in the user coordinate system.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function curve(command: string, points: string[]): string;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

command


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The command to use. Should be one of: c, C, s, S, q, Q.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

points


</td><td>

string\[\]


</td><td>

An array containing all of the points to pass to the curve command, in order. The points are represented as strings of the format ' x, y '.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

string

A string defining one or more Bezier curves. See the MDN documentation for exact format.
